title: Change in energy of book-Earth system

content.question: A person holds a book at rest a few feet above a table. The person then lowers the book at a slow constant speed and places it on the table. Which of the following accurately describes the change in the total mechanical energy of the Earth-book system?

choices.label: The total mechanical energy is unchanged, because there is no change in the bookâ€™s kinetic energy as it is lowered to the table.
The total mechanical energy is unchanged, because no work is done on the Earth-book system while the book is lowered.
The total mechanical energy decreases, because the person does positive work on the book by exerting a force that opposes the gravitational force.
The total mechanical energy decreases, because the person does negative work on the book by exerting a force on the book in the direction opposite to its displacement.

content.answer: The total mechanical energy decreases, because the person does negative work on the book by exerting a force on the book in the direction opposite to its displacement.
